item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain." -- Bob Marley

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Gerard Way
item.description: "If you look in the mirror and don't like what you see, you can find out first hand what it's like to be me." -- Gerard Way

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Keith Richards
item.description: "If you're going to kick authority in the teeth, you might as well use two feet." -- Keith Richards

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "None but ourselves can free our minds." -- Bob Marley

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Without music to decorate it, time is just a bunch of boring production deadlines or dates by which bills must be paid." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: &hearts;weird&hearts; add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde
